title.rendered: Namibia vs Jersey, World Cup Qualifier Play-Off 2023: Fantasy Team, Probable Playing XIs, Pitch Report & Fantasy Tips

content.rendered:
We have opted for a fantasy cricket team on basis of probable XIs, recent performances, overall impact, and credit points.

Probable XIs

Namibia: Niko Davin, Shaun Fouche, Michael van Lingen, Gerhard Erasmus (c), Jan Nicol Loftie-Eaton, Zane Green (wk), Karl Birkenstock, Pikky Ya France, Ruben Trumpelmann, Bernard Scholtz, Ben Shikongo

Jersey: Harrison Carlyon, Nick Greenwood, Josh Lawrenson, Asa Tribe, Jonty Jenner, Benjamin Ward, Julius Sumerauer, Anthony Hawkins-Kay, Jake Dunford (wk), Charles Perchard (c), Elliot Miles

Pitch Report

Venue: Wanderers Cricket Ground, Windhoek

(Based on last three games)

1st innings average score: 234

2nd innings average score: 209

Wickets per innings: 8

Type: Slow wicket

Wins

Batting 1st: 67%

Batting 2nd: 33%

Fantasy Tips of The Day

The following data is based on both ODIs and List A.

Only Shubman Gill (1,262 runs) has scored more runs than Gerhard Erasmus (1,235) since 2021. In addition, he has scalped 16 wickets and pouched 14 catches.

Ruben Trumpleman is in sensational form. He scalped 25 wickets at a strike rate of 21 in his last 10 matches.

Zane Green’s Best11 percentage in last 10 matches reads 70, thanks to 15 dismissals and 240 runs at 30.

Bernard Scholtz has bagged 35 wickets at a strike rate of 31 when defending totals. In addition, he has bowled 28 maiden overs in 23 matches.

Nick Greenwood (385 at 64) and Asa Tribe (325 at 65) are the men in form for Jersey. Collectively, they have slammed two centuries and three half-centuries in their last six games.

Josh Lawrenson has slammed a century and four half-centuries to collect 444 runs at 49 in the last 10 matches.

Elliot Miles made it to the Best11 in three of the last five games, picking eight wickets.

Harrison Carylon’s all-round skills have been keeping fantasy players in the hunt. Aside from scoring 252 runs at 42, he has picked three wickets in his last six matches.

Only once has a team batted the entire quota of 50 overs in the last three matches at the venue. On all five other instances, it was an opener who top scored.
